events.title: Rep. Ciscomani's Big Ugly Vote: Tucson Gathering to Hold Him Accountable w/ ECA & Friends
events.description:
Click here for more information and to register

Rep. Ciscomani voted for The Big Ugly Bill, and we're not letting that go.

We have the opportunity to raise our voices to elected officials who are home this month during the Congressional recess. Let's show Rep. Ciscomani how deeply unpopular it is to vote to slash clean energy, increase pollution, intensify extreme weather, harm community health, and raise his constituents' utility bills!

On Thursday, August 28th, we will gather as a community in front of Rep. Ciscomani's district office. As the workday wraps up, we will express our outrage, peacefully, to departing office staff and to commuters passing by.

Additional guidance and suggestions for making your signs will be provided after registration!

Supporters at this event are for a peaceful and respectful show of support for those causes that further our mission. In the unlikely event that any participants choose to engage in violence or civil disobedience, we ask supporters to remove themselves from the vicinity of the event. In addition, please do not resist crowd control efforts by law enforcement, even if those efforts appear to be political and inappropriate.

The event will start at 9 am to avoid the heat of the day.

location.name: Rep. Ciscomani's Office
location.address: 1636 N Swan Rd, Tucson, AZ 85712, USA

events.title: Dudes for Democracy Bowling Social
events.description:
Have time to spare on Saturday, August 30? Meet up with Dudes 4 Democracy for a striking good time and community building! If you plan on attending, please RSVP to dudes4democracy@proton.me by Thursday, August 28!

Whether you are already civically engaged or looking to meet new friends to canvass or attend events with, this is the place to meet motivated peers in a laid-back setting. Come for a good time, leave with connections and the next steps to save our democracy!

Everyone is a dude! Everyone is welcome!

events.title: UPDATED: Labor Day Community March (Morning)
events.description:
Click here for more information and to register About this event: Join neighbors, union supporters, working families, and advocates for a hopeful, family-friendly march celebrating the dignity of work and the power of solidarity. Unions are the foundation for many working families, providing rights to better working conditions, higher pay, and paid time leave. We‚Äôll gather at 8:00 AM, arriving at the PALF Labor Day picnic around 9:00 AM.

This is a peaceful action at an easy walking pace, so everyone can participate (children are welcome). We‚Äôll have water and shade on site; please prepare for the heat (i.e., wear hats and sunscreen). Musical instruments and signs are welcome.

Guardrails: This feeder march is an independent community action and is not sponsored, endorsed, or staffed by unions. We‚Äôre timing our arrival to coincide respectfully with the picnic program.

Partners / supporters: With support from community allies including Worker Power, UNITE HERE Local 11, Lamplighters, Working Families Power, Honest Arizona, and Care in Action.

Ideas for a signs/slogans: ‚ÄúLabor Solidarity‚Äù ‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúProud Union Supporter‚Äù ‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúWorkers Over Billionaires‚Äù ‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúI Support Collective Bargaining‚Äù ‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúYes to Unions‚Äù

Accessibility: Easy, unhurried pace. Restrooms are available in the park. Reply to your registration email with specific access questions.

üéâ Event Highlights: - Free Admission: Enjoy a day dedicated to celebrating Tucson and Southern Arizona Workers. - Delicious Food - Live Music - Games and Activities: Fun for all ages, including a Kids Corner with pi√±atas. - Folklorico Dancers - Community Partners: Connect with organizations that support workers and their rights.

events.title: Labor Day Community March (Evening)
events.description:
Event currently in develpment. Please check back for updates!

We light the path‚Äîwe walk together. These are peaceful marches independently organized by Lamplighters, union supporters, and allies; not sponsored, endorsed, or staffed by any union.

Join us for a slow-to-moderate pace evening march through downtown. Bring battery candles/flashlights, light wands, glow sticks, etc. for visibility, and wear light/reflective clothing.

Time (subject to change): 6:00 PM meet ‚Ä¢ 6:15 AM step-off ‚Ä¢ wrap by ~7:30 PM Location: Downtown¬†Tucson (exact location TBA) End: Downtown¬†Tucson (exact location TBA)

events.title: Unhappy Birthday, Ciscomani! Rally
events.description:
Click here for more information and to register

On August 31st, it will be Congressman Ciscomani's 43rd birthday. Join the Ciscomani Birthday Coalition to wish Congressman Ciscomani "Unhappy Birthday." We wish for his birthday that he start voting with working Arizonans in mind and stop working on behalf of the ultra-wealthy and corporations.

Bring a balloon and a card to let him know what he should wish for his constituents when he blows out his birthday candles.

Organized by the Ciscomani Birthday Coalition

events.title: Take Action Tuesday
events.description:
Join us for a twice-monthly meeting where Take Action Tucson invites local organizations to share their latest updates and present ways that our community can stay civically engaged and get involved in pro-democracy action.

This meeting will be held in-person and livestreamed. In-person attendees will have the opportunity to connect directly with the organizers during the later part of the meeting. If attending in person, please park at the N Treat Ave parking lot and enter through that the N Treat Ave entrance.

Click here to register for virtual attendance

events.title: Noncooperation Workshop + Discussion
events.description:
Click here for more information and to register

This training will cover non-violent direct action, the authoritarian and anti-authoritarian playbooks, the tactic of noncooperation and how to deploy it in the US, and a discussion on what Tucson needs to become a hub for noncooperation in this country.

Freedom Trainers has trained over 250,000 people in 2025 to oppose authoritarianism and practice strategic noncooperation. At this training we will explore the authoritarian playbook and how to counter it. We will pull in examples from authoritarian regimes across the world, and practice tactics in real time.

events.title: People Power Series: Organizing to Protect Democracy Session 3
events.description:
Click here for more information and to register

Ready to turn your passion into action? Join the second session in ACLU People Power's New Series: Organizing to Protect Democracy, happening on September 9th at 8 PM ET!

We are in the fight of a lifetime to defend our rights, our freedoms, and our democracy. This is the third session in our free, high impact, virtual training series built to ignite your activism and give you the tools to organize, mobilize, and lead in this critical moment. Our communities need bold action, and we need you in the fight.

You'll learn how to: Organize effectively in your community Have persuasive conversations that move people to action Build lasting connections with others who are ready to rise to the moment

This is the third in a 4-part training series that is designed for people ready to turn passion into action - and to take on an even greater leadership role in their community. Space is limited, so sign up now to reserve your spot. All we ask is that you commit to attend and share info about this training with friends and family. Organizing is relational, and the path forward depends on all of us.

Now is the moment to stand up for our democracy, so join us for this training and be part of the movement for change.

events.title: CEBV Civics Series: State Government
events.description:
Click here for more information and to register

Learn all about how Arizona's state government works! This training will include the Arizona State Legislature, Statewide Offices & Commissions, and your role in making change!

This will be a virtual training with lots of time for questions.

events.title: Showing Up Safer - Protest Safety Workshop
events.description:
Click here for more info and to register

When your conscience calls for you to stand up and protest ‚Äî How do you keep yourself and others safe?

In this workshop you will learn to safely engage in public events like protests and marches.

The program covers bias awareness, risk assessment, and understanding local social concerns with the goal that faith leaders and communities can participate in activism more safely and effectively.

Led by Rae Strozzo, a Tucson artist, writer, educator and activist.
